briefTitle: Asthma in Families Facing Out-of-pocket Requirements Due to COVID-19
officialTitle: Comparing Patient-Centered Outcomes for Adults and Children With Asthma in High-Deductible Health Plans With and Without Preventive Drug Lists: COVID Enhancement

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Aim 1:

Inclusion Criteria:

* Adults aged 18-64 years who have asthma or have a child with asthma aged 4-17 years
* Lost employer-sponsored health insurance after COVID-19 was declared a pandemic in March 2020

Exclusion Criteria:

* Previous use of AAFA's insurance chat bot

Aim 2 (qualitative study):

As above, plus:

Inclusion Criteria:

\- Completed four-month follow-up survey for Aim 1

primary.description: Coverage status (has any insurance coverage or not)

secondary.description: Report of using less asthma medication than prescribed because of cost
Report of: 1) problems paying medical bills for asthma care, or 2) having to borrow money because of the amount required to pay for asthma care
Change in report of: 1) using less asthma medication than prescribed because of cost,or 2) delaying or avoiding going to the doctor for asthma because of cost
